intro: Burnettia, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. The plants are characterized by their showy, yellow or orange flowers with five petals, often surrounded by sepals that resemble additional petals. They typically grow in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Burnettia species are often found in meadows and forested areas at high elevations.
